net.antidot.api.search
Class CoderBase

java.lang.Object
  net.antidot.api.search.CoderBase
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultFeedCoder, DefaultFilterCoder
public abstract class CoderBase
extends java.lang.Object

Base class for coder.

Coders use generic methods to decode and/or encode data. These methods are grouped here.

escapeAndJoin

protected java.lang.String escapeAndJoin(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> values,
                                         java.lang.String regex,
                                         java.lang.String joinCharacter)
Escapes each element of the collection according to provided regex and joins them to build result. regex should contain a group which will be escaped by the escape character.

Example

  • Let's suppose values contains following elements: foo_bar_baz and bat_bal.
  • With a regular expression defined as: (_|f).
  • Result of the call to this method is: <escape>foo<escape>_bar<escape>_baz<joinCharacter>bat<escape>_bal.

Parameters:
values - [in] list of value to work on.
regex - [in] regular expression to apply on each value of @a values.
joinCharacter - [in] character used to @a values after modification.
Returns:
string result of joined modified values.

split

protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> split(java.lang.String value,
                                                 java.lang.String splitCharacter)
Splits input value according to split character. This is the inverse process of escapeAndJoin(Collection, String, String).

Each splitted element is unescaped.

Example

  • Let's suppose value is: <escape>foo<escape>_bar<escape>_baz<joinCharacter>bat<escape>_bal.
  • Result of the call to this method is list of following values: foo_bar_baz and bat_bal.

Parameters:
value - [in] value to split and unescape.
splitCharacter - [in] character used to split input.
Returns:
list of splitted elements.
